homePage.txtDescription: The citizen portal provides users with the ability to create their own user profile using an email address, password, and Cyrillic names as they appear on the user's identity document. With the created unique user profile, the user has access to:
homePage.txtLi1: View data in their user profile and add authentication methods to it
homePage.txtLi3: View documents related to a current or completed service requested by the user
homePage.txtLi4: Check the status of a current service

help.txtEmpowermentLegalEntity:
Filling out a new empowerment statement  - At this stage, you need to complete the information for the empowerment:

Applicant data:

  • On behalf of:  Select the "Legal entity" option to issue a statement on behalf of the legal entity you are part of.

  • As:  Fill in the position you hold within the legal entity.

  • EIC/Bulstat of the legal entity: Enter a valid EIC/BULSTAT of the legal entity.

  • Legal Entity Name: Fill in the name of the legal entity.

Legal Representatives:

  • Identifier: Select either EGN (*for Bulgarian citizens only) or  LNCH.

  • EGN/LNCH of legal representative: Enter a valid Uniform civil number (EGN) or Personal foreigner number (LNCH) (depending on the selected identifier);

  • Names of legal representative: Fill in the full name of the legal representative as per their ID card in Bulgarian.  

*Important!: If the representation of the legal entity is “Jointly” or “In Another Manner,” you must provide the details for each legal representative who has the right to authorize. You can add additional fields by using the “Add legal representatives +” button.

Empowered persons:

  • Identifier: Select either EGN (*for Bulgarian citizens only) or  LNCH.

  • EGN/LNCH number of the empowered  person:  Enter details about the person/s you wish to empower. You must provide their valid Uniform civil number (EGN) or Personal foreigner number (LNCH) (depending on the selected identifier);

*In case you want to empower more than one person, you can add more fields for empowered persons using the "Add empowered person +" button.

Empowerment:

  • Empowerment type:  When more than one empowered person is added, the "Empowerment type" field appears, in which you must choose whether the empowered persons will be able to use  power of attorney "Together Only" or "Separately":

*For the"Together Only" option, a single empowerment is generated, which you must sign. Accordingly, it can only be used when the two empowered persons identify themselves before DEAU together.

*For the  "Separately" option,  a separate empowerment is generated for each entered proxy. Each empowerment is signed separately and is valid independently.

  • Service Provider:  Select the service provider for which you want the empowerment to be valid.

  • Service: Specify the service for which you wish to authorize the selected individuals to act on your behalf.

  • Extent of representative authority: Choose the extent of their representative authority.

  • Start Date:  Select the date from which the empowerment will take effect.

  • End Date: Indicate the date until which the authorization will be valid.

*Important!: If no end date is specified, the empowerment automatically becomes indefinite.

  • Review and Submit:  After completing the empowerment, press the "Review and Submit" button to review the final document.

Submission of the empowerment statement  - Carefully check the entered information, and make sure that all the data is correct. If everything is fine, press "Submit a statement":

  • After pressing the button, a window will appear with a warning that the statement will be submitted, press "Submit".

  • Upon successful submission, the new empowerment statement will be visible in the "From me" section with the status "Sign". To complete the process of submitting the new empowerment, you must follow the steps to sign with a Qualified Electronic Signature (QES) or a Cloud Qualified Electronic Signature (CQES).
help.txtEmpowermentIndividual:
Filling out a new empowerment statement  - At this stage, you need to complete the information for the empowerment:

Applicant data:

  • On behalf of:  Select the “Individual” option to issue a new empowerment on your behalf.

Empowered persons:

  • Identifier: Choose a unique civil number EGN (*for Bulgarian citizens only) or personal foreigner number LNCH.

  • EGN/LNCH number of the empowered  person:  Enter details about the person/s you wish to empower. You must provide their valid Uniform civil number (EGN) or Personal foreigner number (LNCH) (depending on the selected identifier);

*In case you want to empower more than one person, you can add more fields for empowered persons using the "Add empowered person +" button.

Empowerment:

  • Empowerment type:  When more than one empowered person is added, the "Empowerment type" field appears, in which you must choose whether the empowered persons will be able to use  power of attorney "Together Only" or "Separately":

*For the"Together Only" option, a single empowerment is generated, which you must sign. Accordingly, it can only be used when the two empowered persons identify themselves before DEAU together.

*For the  "Separately" option,  a separate empowerment is generated for each entered proxy. Each empowerment is signed separately and is valid independently.

  • Service Provider:  Select the service provider for which you want the empowerment to be valid.

  • Service: Specify the service for which you wish to authorize the selected individuals to act on your behalf.

  • Extent of representative authority: Choose the extent of their representative authority.

  • Start Date:  Select the date from which the empowerment will take effect.

  • End Date: Indicate the date until which the authorization will be valid.

*Important!: If no end date is specified, the empowerment automatically becomes indefinite.

  • Review and Submit:  After completing the empowerment, press the "Review and Submit" button to review the final document.

Submission of the empowerment statement  - Carefully check the entered information, and make sure that all the data is correct. If everything is fine, press "Submit a statement":

  • After pressing the button, a window will appear with a warning that the statement will be submitted, press "Submit".

  • Upon successful submission, the new empowerment statement will be visible in the "From me" section with the status "Sign". To complete the process of submitting the new empowerment, you must follow the steps to sign with a Qualified Electronic Signature (QES) or a Cloud Qualified Electronic Signature (CQES).
help.txtEmpowermentNoSelection:
Filling out a new empowerment statement  - At this stage, you need to complete the information for the empowerment:

Applicant data:

  • On behalf of: You can choose one of the following options:
    *“Individual” - to issue a new empowerment on your behalf.
    *"Legal entity" - to issue a new empowerment on behalf of a legal entity you are part of.
help.txtRegistrationInformation:
Information

The Citizen Portal provides an opportunity for users to create their own user profile using an email address, password, and names in Cyrillic as written in the user's identification document. Through the created unique user profile, the user has access to:

  • View the data in their user profile and add authentication methods to it

  • Request electronic administrative services

  • View documents for a current or completed service requested by the user

  • View the status of the execution of a current service

  • View payments made for services

  • View logs

  • Manage notifications
